headline: 'The Five' panel on return to table, Biden-Putin summit, 'woke' school

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: This is so strange. Hi. I'm Greg Gutfeld with Dagen McDowell, Richard Fowler, Jesse Watters, and she once got caught in the undertow in her bathtub, Dana Perino back at the table. So here we are, finally back to the table. It's like the first day back at school, remember that when you couldn't wait to get back and show off your summer tan and the neat star you got at fat camp? And now you get to sit next to your best friend to the cafeteria, it's a brand-new day. But it's weird to see all of us in person again and up so close, it's like a class and advanced dermatology. Jesse's hair is as big and as shiny as ever. It's more than a hair. It's a safety device. It's not as thick as it was 15 months ago. Why do you -- it's fact. Jesse is getting old, he's losing it.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Similar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The hair. And he had a baby. Good job, birthing person. As the baby gets hair, Jesse loses his. It's the balding circle of like.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Look at the baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Speaking of pests, Dana is back sitting on a stack of dog pictures which is probably good for her since this morning she had her first colonoscopy, a milestone in one's life, it's kind of like your first date in that before both you are covered with sweat and paralyzed by explosive diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We are making that public?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I should have asked. I should have asked. My fault. But wait. But we're so glad you made it here anyway. Since we left the table, I've lost 30 pounds.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't just get my hunch removed. I just decided to exercise more. No. Before I was a strong seven but now, I am an irresistible 9.3. No wonder this happens. Check that out. A proposal, a proposal on Friday night, can you blame him? I'd marry myself if that wasn't illegal. That's in Detroit where everything is legal. But if you told us 15 months ago that this how long it would take to return, we all would've laughed at you. But if Jeffrey Toobin can come back, why can't we? But we hope you are as happy to see us here as we are as happy to see each other and if you are not, just like your germs, keep them to yourself. I have to commend you, Dana, after I applied the peer pressure, you had a fairly invasive procedure this morning and yet you showed up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think that's happened. So, when we first started THE FIVE, I was 10 years away -- well, actually, yes, 11 years away from needing a colonoscopy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's all I know. Yes, OK. So, America, yes, that's what I did this morning. And I wasn't sure we would talk about that. But since we are, everybody should get their checks, they just changed it to 45.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They lowered it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Which is why I had to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I had to go back in time and get a retroactive colonoscopy which often like watching CNN.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But that's great because you get to go to sleep for like 25 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's the best.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's like the best sleep you ever had.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's the best just getting knocked out. So, Jesse, you are kind of like now part of the family. It took -- it took a few mistakes and writing a book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I love being back at the table because I have something to prop my book up on. There it is, hard copy. Greg, was it a man that propose to you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. I just want to make sure the audience knows that, that was a guy. I do like being back at the table because I'm tall again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You guys are now short.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm so short.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We couldn't see that in the boxes so that makes me feel better. I can also get a little whiff of Richard's cologne, what is that, Tom Ford, Richard?

utterances.speaker: RICHARD FOWLER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to tell you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. I can read Dana's body language when I cross the line.

utterances.speaker: PERNO
utterances.sentences: I can hold your hand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can hold my hand again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Now we're back safe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Again, we can consensually touch each other. Greg has to listen to me. He can't bury his face in his own notes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true. That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Dagen can't wear track pants. I don't know why that's important to me but it's very important.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: You commented on that a lot during COVID. You've seen me like, are you going to get dressed when you come to work? It was the track pants or shorts is to wear.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, it's important that we are all here because now we can -- it's also the cues that you get from people's faces that you are missing when we are on, in the vans so we end up talking over it -- well we can't help it because there was a tape delay. But we end up not knowing when to shut up like I'm doing now.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, even in the socially distanced stools that we were sitting on I am legally blind.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So, I couldn't even see you then, Jesse could have been knitting booties for junior or you could have been dressed up like Yosemite Sam and I wouldn't have known it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You are so far away which we know you only you on the weekends.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. The CHAPS. Richard, what are you -- are you excited to be back on our first day?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I am excited to be back on your first day,Â congratulations, back at the table. And I commend you on the weight loss, I mean, you know, like every -- like most Americans I gained the COVID 30, but I've dropped the COVID 30 as well, thanks to a personal trainer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I had the choice, you go in one direction which is eating and drinking into oblivion or not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I chose the not. So.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's great. I mean, there's been a lot. It was funny I was thinking about how we sat here and said OK, well, see you in two weeks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Flatten the curve.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Like it was going to flatten the curve, we'll see you in two weeks. At most, three --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and it really was a really long year for a lot of people. And now people are making this decision to come back to work or not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would just say that if you are hesitating, and I get it. Like there might be a lot of reasons, I do think that the first like, 24 hours back in the office feels weird and then you're like right back in the saddle and it's great to be around people again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Especially at a rodeo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wonder if they say that at the Rodeo. This is not my first day on the job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's not my first day in the office.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They don't say this is not my first rodeo. Here's a good question I just thought of. If this happened again next year, what would we do differently? I'm going to say no lockdowns.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good question.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I think you'd isolate the elderly and the sick and the rest of the country could maybe go about their business in a safe, clean way. Maybe you'd learn that. People are still wearing masks, though, I saw someone on the beach wearing a mask and I didn't want to reverse mask shame her --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- because she was renting the house next to me and that would have been awkward but also, watching the NBA playoffs this weekend, you see these guys they're sweating all over each other, they're boxing each other, they're in each other's face talking trash and then they go to the bench, they have to sit 6 feet separate and wear a mask. I mean, what -- does the commissioner know something we don't know, that's the dumbest thing I've ever heard. So, I think a lot of this is still superstition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, it's like we have -- we need probably more consistency and guidance. But I -- what did -- do we have any proof that the lockdowns actually helped? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know that we do, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think that a lot of it, like the after-action report as it's called has yet to be -- like, maybe it helped in some ways, right? So, we know that sometimes in super crowded areas, you could get that if people weren't masked and at the beginning that was happening but we did know pretty early on that schools were not a place of transmission.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We knew that planes were not a place of transmission. Do you know that I believe this has held up, there's not a single case of a patient to a dentist or a dentist to a patient getting COVID. And you had -- think of how many dentist's office had to shut down with all those months.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And colonoscopy offices too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, eight weeks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Eight weeks.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I got my colonoscopy my first went too during the -- during the last year, like last November and just thinking about the prep makes me --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- (Inaudible) a little bit. What --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The key is not to eat for two days.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But I'm still -- I'm still 20 pounds heavier even with the cleanup. One thing about the upside though for the lockdowns, just quick, was that productivity soared at some companies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Like at --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the conundrum, right?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Like technology companies because people were working more hours because they were working the hours --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not commuting.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- not to commute.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And now these businesses want them back in New York and what they're going to have are fractious, angry employees who don't do anything.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Do less work.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, we learned that commuting is the worst thing you may not need any more, that you need consistency, that putting people in with their elder it was a bad idea. Children should be at school. I mean, we actually for the -- this was a good practice run even though a lot of people didn't make it through.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: And I think -- I think we also learned that if you are sick, stay home. I think people were like, I mean, before you would take a rest --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: -- I have a fever, I'm going to run into the pharmacy to get some pills.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Now you're like, actually, I'm not going to go to the pharmacy, I'm going to stay home.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: And that's a good thing, that's a way to be kind to your neighbors.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. All right. Coming up, President Biden and allies calling for a COVID investigation but are they playing right into China's hands?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's not Elton John.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: We haven't had access to the laboratories to determine whether or not -- and I haven't reached a conclusion because our intelligence community is not certain yet whether or not this was a consequence of a, from the market place of a bat or whether it was an experiment gone awry in a laboratory.

utterances.speaker: MIKE POMPEO, FORMER U.S. SECRETARY OF STATE
utterances.sentences: There is an enormous amount of evidence that there was a leak from the Wuhan Institute of Virology, there's a pile of evidence 100 feet high.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: What is the point? You know what, is it too much to ask for these leaders to just get angry?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: To just get mad. Instead they issue this watery, if not sugary statement --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- about a phase two probe, a second probe, by the World Health Organization in their first report got access to no data from China and then suggested that it was more likely, communist propaganda, by the way, more likely that the Wuhan virus was imported into China in frozen food, that was a more likely source than the Wuhan lab. And China is sitting back watching these numbskulls laughing, it's this boondoggle at the beach with the photo op seaside and then what did Boris Johnson say on Friday talking about we must build back in a greener, more gender-neutral, perhaps more feminine way. Meantime, four million, almost four million people are dead around the globe and China was the only economy growing last year. They are toothless, all of them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, Dagen was referencing the photo op, Richard, where all the vaccinated leaders were doing a little elbow bump. I don't know what that was about. But address the point that the Chinese are not going to let people that are not handpicked into their country to look around, so what are we actually going to do? What would Richard Fowler do, leader of the free world, to really confront China and get to the bottom of the situation?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Thank you for giving me title leader of the free world, I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Number one, if I were the leader of the free world the first thing I would do is not have --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kill Jesse.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, I might keep Jesse around. You've got to have some help. You know, team of rivals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Keep me around, Keep me around.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I got to keep him -- I might put him in the cabinet. But I don't think I would have the World Health Organization investigate this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I would probably have somebody else do it, maybe the IAEA, somebody who has some more credibility when it comes to investigating things in authoritarian countries, number one. But number two, where I will give the G7 credit it was the beachy picture, but remember, at last year's G7 they didn't even mention the word China in their communique, neither in the year before or the year before that. So the fact that the G7 which is a group of people that I really don't like to offend anybody decided that they were going to offend China by saying, hey, you have human rights violations, we think that you guys might have sort of, there's a possibility that there was a lab leak here so you guys spread COVID to the world so you guys are bad actors. I think that's a big step in the right direction for a group of people that don't like taking big steps.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did you see come out of this G7, Dana? Was there anything concrete besides this little wishy-washy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I wrote down, they had the statement, we will continue to consult, which is so pathetic I can't believe they felt the need to actually have to write it down and issue it to the world that they are going to -- well that's of course you are, that's the G7.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But that's in -- that was in reference to the Wuhan lab leak possibility, so it came out of it. So, you have this build back better world, B3W, I think it's called, and this was the idea that finally G7 is going to try to take on China on its Belt and Road Initiative.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is basically where China was just handing out contracts and money all around the world and basically taking everybody's resources from all around the world and actually not following through on anything that they promise. So, I talked to a friend recently had a good point, so we can either outsmart China, but we are not going to ever outspend them. So maybe this is perhaps a little bit of a concrete thing. I think it's kind of strange that it's built on Biden's campaign promise to America, the build back better, I don't know if that was a good idea for the G7. But other than that, it felt a little bit toothless, they also kept saying that they're so glad that they now have a president willing to cooperate. Part of what they mean by that is that willing to cooperate on the Iran nuclear deal --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- for example, the climate Paris accord, and then also this idea of, a trash idea that I will call the global minimum tax which is not necessarily going to happen but they agreed to look into it, and basically what that would do is screw America's tech companies.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Greg, the president keeps been saying America is back. Well, back to getting manipulated by the Europeans?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Back to bending over, that's what it is. By the way, the summit was so boring that networks were forced to show old clips of like, remember Trump? Well, we hated him. This is really funny or Yeltsin dancing. The most interesting thing at the summit was Boris Johnson's hair which looked like a beach umbrella in a windstorm. It's just at any moment it could just fly off into space. Concerning these comments about China, I have coined a phrase, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I like to hear it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The soft language of no expectations. That is a beautiful phrase which the media is already in the process of portraying as adults, isn't this adult, the idea of cooperation being adult. What we -- what I've always tried to push is that I would rather have my leader be like an agent or a lawyer that everybody hates so they don't expect cooperation and that they know it's going to be hard. I don't want them to have -- I don't want -- I want the freak show, you know? I don't want this -- I don't want this civilize photo op, to me that just looks like it's just another game. But Biden could start a war and the media would be like, at least he's not Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They are continuing to consult.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I will say, can I give one thing that I thought --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- was a positive was the agreement to try to help give vaccines to third world countries, that's positive. They can definitely --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: And I think, Dana, to add to your point. The fact that they are doing this is also a counter way to the fact that Russia and China are giving out their vaccine, not as effective, but they're giving out their vaccine --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: -- with strings attached similar to many of the foreign direct investment road projects.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think we should have some strings attached to our vaccine.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because that's good diplomacy, Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: That's not good diplomacy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's diplomacy. Vaccine diplomacy.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Anybody that's taking money from China for Belt and Road, let's just flood them with vaccines then they'll maybe come to our side. Ahead, President Biden promising to retaliate against cyber-attacks ahead of that big summit with Vladimir Putin.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I'm going to make clear to President Putin that there are areas where we can cooperate if he chooses and if he chooses not to cooperate and acts in a way that he has in the past relative to cybersecurity and some other activities, then we will respond. We will respond in kind.

utterances.speaker: KEIR SIMMONS, SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT, NBC
utterances.sentences: Are you waging a cyber war against America? VLADIMIR PUTIN, RUSSIAN PRESIDENT (through translator): Where is the evidence? Where is proof? It's becoming farcical.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: What's your take about what do you think is happening in the sort of Biden White House as they prepare for one of the biggest meetings of his presidency so far?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, a couple of different things. One, I think that right there in that interview you just saw, I believe Putin when he says where the evidence just like I believe the Chinese when they are like, there is no lab leak. I mean, I don't like -- I think that we just have to presume. Of course, we know where it's coming from. We know that he doesn't tell the truth. We know what he does to journalists in his own country. And he's down on this propaganda tour all around basically saying I am bigger and better than Biden. And I do seriously wonder why the White House called this a summit because a summit indicates that it's grand and it's big, where I said I think that they should've said, we are going to get coffee with Putin when we're over there in Brussels, that will be -- or in Geneva, we're going to stop by and have a couple -- cups of espresso and that's it. Because right now, what's different from when I was working for President Bush is that these attacks, these cyber-attacks are actually affecting normal people.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When you're talking about the money, when you're talking about like Colonial Pipeline, that's your gas. You're talking about meat, that's like our supply chain for how we actually feed ourselves, this summit or whatever they're going to call it is super important. The last thing I would say is, I think if you're going to have a summit, you have to have a press conference. If you are the leader of the free world then you have to have the other leader even if he is reluctant to stand next to you or maybe if you are concerned how you will look standing next to him, I still think that you have to do it in order to show that the media matters.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Fair point. Jesse, your take?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I agree with everything Dana said, he had a very, very shaky performance today during that press conference, they asked him, well you said Vlad is a killer, what gave you that impression and how do you negotiate with a killer? And he laughed like Kamala Harris and then he started to answer and then he paused for 10 seconds and then he restarted his answer was something completely unintelligible. I have no idea what he said, Richard, and that did not strike me as someone that's in command of the issues. They were asking what the goals are going into this meeting, he said he's not going to negotiate in front of the press but he did that yesterday. Putin floated the idea of the cyber- criminal swap and he said oh, yes, I'm open to it. And then the White House had to walk it bac. So, he seems confused to me. I don't think he's going to do well one on one with Vladimir Putin, he is going to probably do a lot of listening and he's probably going to be reading off a lot of script and then they are going to release a readout that says we challenged him here, they disagreed here, and the media is going to make him out to be Rambo. But that's not really the point. The point is you have to do something to Vladimir Putin to kind of snap him to attention and right now he hasn't done anything, he's let the pipeline go, he's trying to get back into the Iran nuke deal and he hasn't really -- he's basically surrendered on the cyber war. So, to Dana's point, almost every major summit you have with a Russian leader, you hold a joint news conference right afterwards. By holding a solo news conference that doesn't signal strength to me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That signals weakness to me. So, it's not like an arm-wrestling match, just go out there and answer questions.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: See, I mean, I want to push back on that a little bit because I think I've watched it. I think the White House is definitely setting lower expectations, they are setting the bar low so that they can come out with something high.
